qas.question: What form of speech shows that Sanskrit and Prakrits existed together?
What type of speakers spoke Sanskrit?
For what did Brahmins use Sanskrit?
Until what period was high Sanskrit used?
How large of a group in society use Sanskrit?
What kind of dramas used exclusively the Sanskrit language?
What language was spoken by the less educated?
What trait in the enlightened era did most Sanskrit speakers pocess?
Who used Sanskrit for common communication?
In what single location was Sanskrit centralized and maintained?

context: Many <a0_0><b5_0>Sanskrit dramas<b5_0/><a0_0/> also indicate that the language coexisted with <b6_0>Prakrits<b6_0/>, spoken by <a1_0>multilingual<a1_0/> speakers with a more extensive education. Sanskrit speakers were almost always <b7_0>multilingual<b7_0/>. In the medieval era, Sanskrit continued to be spoken and written, particularly by learned <b8_0>Brahmins<b8_0/> for <a2_0>scholarly communication<a2_0/>. This was a <a4_0>thin layer<a4_0/> of Indian society, but covered a wide geography. Centres like <b9_0>Varanasi<b9_0/>, Paithan, Pune and Kanchipuram had a strong presence of teaching and debating institutions, and high classical Sanskrit was maintained until <a3_0>British times<a3_0/>.
